A. Bayona]] |[[J. D. Payne]], [[Patrick McKay]] |[[1 September]] [[2022]] |25 Million{{webcite|author=Rick Porter|articleurl=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/lotr-rings-of-power-day-1-record-viewing-amazon-1235211790/|articlename=Amazon Claims First-Day Record Audience for ‘Rings of Power’|dated=September 3 2022|website=The Hollywood Reporter|accessed=14 December 2025|archiveurl=|archivename=|archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Galadriel]] is disturbed by signs of [[Sauron|an ancient evil’s]] return; [[Arondir]] makes [[Hordern|an unsettling discovery]]; [[Elrond]] is presented with an intriguing new venture; [[Elanor Brandyfoot|Nori]] breaks the [[Harfoots|Harfoot community]]’s most deeply-held rule. |- |2 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[Adrift]]" |[[J. A. Bayona]] |[[Gennifer Hutchison]] |[[1 September]] [[2022]] |25 Million |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Galadriel]] finds [[Halbrand|a new ally]]; [[Elrond]] faces a cold reception from [[Durin IV|an old friend]]; [[Elanor Brandyfoot|Nori]] endeavors to help [[The Stranger|a Stranger]]; [[Arondir]] searches for answers while [[Bronwyn]] warns [[Tirharad|her people]] of [[Orcs|a threat]]." |- |3 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[Adar (episode)|Adar]]" |[[Wayne Che Yip]] |[[Jason Cahill]], [[Justin Doble]] |[[9 September]] [[2022]] |≈17.4 Million{{webcite|author=Selome Hailu |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/cobra-kai-rings-of-power-house-of-the-dragon-nielsen-streaming-top-0-1235395023/ |articlename=Nielsen Streaming Top 10: ‘Cobra Kai’ Debuts at No. 1, ‘Rings of Power’ Still Edges Out ‘House of the Dragon’ |dated=October 6 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=14 December 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Arondir]] finds himself a captive; [[Galadriel]] and [[Halbrand]] explore [[Númenor|a legendary kingdom]]; [[Elendil]] is given a new assignment; [[Nori]] faces the consequences. |- |4 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[The Great Wave]]" |[[Wayne Che Yip]] |[[Stephany Folsom]], [[J.D. Payne]], [[Patrick McKay]] |[[16 September]] [[2022]] |≈13.9 Million{{webcite |author=Jennifer Maas |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/cobra-kai-season-5-ratings-house-of-the-dragon-rings-of-power-1235402590/ |articlename=Nielsen Streaming Top 10: ‘Cobra Kai’ Reaches Nearly 2 Billion Minutes Watched as ‘House of the Dragon’ and ‘Rings of Power’ Slip |dated=October 13 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=14 December 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Tar-Míriel|Queen Regent Míriel's]] faith is tested; [[Isildur]] finds himself at a crossroads; [[Elrond]] uncovers [[Mithril|a secret]]; [[Arondir]] is given an ultimatum; [[Theo]] disobeys [[Bronwyn]]. |- |5 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[Partings]]" |[[Wayne Che Yip]] |[[Justin Doble]] |[[23 September]] [[2022]] |≈13.6 Million{{webcite |author=Selome Hailu |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/jeffrey-dahmer-monster-nielsen-top-10-streaming-1235410181/ |articlename=Jeffrey Dahmer Series ‘Monster’ Debuts on Nielsen Top 10 With 10th Biggest Streaming Week Ever |dated=October 20 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=14 December 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Elanor Brandyfoot|Nori]] questions her instincts; [[Elrond]] struggles to stay true to his oath; [[Halbrand]] weighs his destiny; [[Men|The Southlanders]] brace for attack. |- |6 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[Udûn (episode)|Udun]]" |[[Charlotte Brändström]] |[[Nicholas Adams]], [[Justin Doble]], [[J.D. Payne]], [[Patrick McKay]] |[[30 September]] [[2022]] |≈14 Million{{webcite |author=BreAnna Bell |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/dahmer-monster-record-hocus-pocus-2-nielsen-opening-weekend-1235416167/ |articlename=Nielsen Streaming Top 10: ‘Dahmer’ Beats Its Own Monster Record, ‘Hocus Pocus 2’ Has Biggest Ever Opening Weekend for a Movie |dated=October 27 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=14 December 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Adar (The Rings of Power)|Adar]] and his army march on [[Watchtower of Ostirith|Ostirith]]. |- |7 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[The Eye]]" |[[Charlotte Brändström]] |[[Jason Cahill]] |[[7 October]] [[2022]] |≈13.7 Million{{webcite |author=BreAnna Bell |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/netflix-last-seen-alive-no-6-dahmer-hocus-pocus-2-continue-to-reign-1235422470/ |articlename=Nielsen Streaming Top 10: Netflix’s ‘Last Seen Alive’ Opens at No. 6 as ‘Dahmer,‘ ’Hocus Pocus 2′ Continue to Reign |dated=November 3 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=December 14 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |[[Men|Survivors]] of [[Mount Doom|a cataclysm]] try to find safety; the [[Harfoots]] confront [[Mystics|evil]]; [[Durin VI|Durin]] is torn between [[Elrond|friendship]] and [[Durin III|duty]]; [[Adar (The Rings of Power)|Adar]] considers [[Mordor|a new name]]. |- |8 | style="text-align:left;" |"[[Alloyed]]" |[[Wayne Che Yip]] |[[Gennifer Hutchison]], [[J.D. Payne]], [[Patrick McKay]] |[[14 October]] [[2022]] |≈15.3 Million{{webcite |author=BreAnna Bell |articleurl=https://variety.com/2022/streaming/ratings/halloween-ends-peacock-nielsen-streaming-top-10-debut-1235429619/ |articlename=‘Halloween Ends’ Scores Peacock Its Nielsen Streaming Top 10 Debut |dated=November 10 2022 |website=Variety |accessed=14 December 2025 |archiveurl= |archivename= |archivedate=}} |- | colspan="6" style="text-align:left" |Season One Finale.
